laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal; no white matter lesions or other abnormalities, except for an incidental right frontal mucocele.
Normal or negative for vitamin B12, folic acid, copper, homocysteine, proteinogram, thyroid hormones, HIV, HTLV-1, and Lyme disease.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At 6-month follow-up, blood tests revealed decreased cortisol basal level (3.8 mg/dL) and increased basal ACTH level (1,945 pg/mL) consistent with nonautoimmune adrenal insufficiency.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Increased latency in the central components of upper limb potentials, altered potentials in lower limbs.
Greater delay in the lower than the upper limbs.
Bilateral hypometabolism in the paramedian frontal, anterior parietal, and temporal lobes.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Plasma levels of very long-chain fatty acids (VLCFA)
laboratory_examinations.findings: High plasma levels consistent with adrenomyeloneuropathy (AMN).
No mutations of SPG4 or frataxin genes were found.
